programme.desc: Comedian Lee Evans stars in this adaptation of HG Wells' novel about an ordinary man who turns his back on a failing business and loveless marriage to pursue his dreams. Driven to despair by the aimlessness of life in the drapery trade, unfriendly neighbours and the incessant nagging of his wife, Alfred Polly decides to end it all.

programme.title: Jordskott

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: Michael has a breakthrough in his hunt for the Blackwells and the police believe his arrest is imminent. However, Joe is worried he's made a mistake that could endanger his family. Meanwhile, an unsettled Ali makes an impulsive decision after receiving devastating news, Robert tackles Mark about past events and Katy questions the former detective further, still unsure about his methods. Drama, starring Christopher Eccleston, Nicola Stephenson, Marsha Thomason, Peter Ferdinando and Max True.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: Joe and Sam head off across the lake and find themselves caught up in a terrifying ordeal. Robert works with Mark to resolve the situation, but there are devastating consequences in store for both him and the family. He begins to think that his friend and former boss, Mark, isn't to be trusted after all. Drama, starring Christopher Eccleston, Marsha Thomason and Paterson Joseph. Last in the series.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney is woken in the early hours by a fire in the village and, putting his life on the line, races to rescue Marion Taylor from the burning house, much to the relief of her husband Dominic. But there are questions surrounding the blaze - was it really an accident, and why was Marion so reluctant to leave? Normally Sidney would turn to Geordie to help solve a mystery like this, but he finds the detective is far from his usual self. When Dominic is then found stabbed to death, it's Geordie's junior, Atkins, who is sent to head up the case - and he's not exactly a fan of interfering vicars.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper: Not Like That, Like This
programme.desc: Feature-length biopic of the much-loved comedian, written by Simon Nye and starring David Threlfall (Shameless). When Tommy's extensive touring starts to affect his home life and his health, his doting wife Gwen, whom he nicknamed Dove, decides she cannot go on the road with him any longer, so he asks stage manager Mary to act as his assistant. Her unwavering support makes all the difference to the star's performances and the pair soon embark on an affair. For the next 17 years, Tommy finds himself unable to choose between these two equally devoted women, and his death on live TV in 1984 means he never makes that decision. With Amanda Redman, Helen McCrory, Jason Manford, Gregor Fisher and Paul Ritter.(n)

Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris.(n)

programme.desc: Orla and Wayne are on a collision course with Jane, Mondo is tempted to continue his dodgy dealings with Hayley, and Rachel decides to teach Paul a lesson.(n)

programme.title: At Your Service
programme.desc: Hoteliers Francis and John Brennan try to help and invigorate business at An Grianan, the college of the Irish Countrywomen's Association. President Liz Wall asks if they can revive their 17th-century house and grounds, which contains 53 bedrooms, a 120-seat dining room, six self-catering cottages and a small shop. To keep the site alive, they need to attract new members and people to their courses - but it is a huge task for the Brennans. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Abhainn
programme.desc: Padraig O'Driscoll follows the River Nore, which rises in the shadow of the Devil's Bit Mountain in north Tipperary. Meeting people who live along the route of the waterway in Co Laois and Co Kilkenny, Padraig learns about the history of local art, hurling and cricket, as well as tales of ancient monks brewing beer, and string quartets playing on the banks. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey is shocked to learn Jean is planning to marry Ollie tomorrow, and asks if she has been taking her medication. However, it is her mum's turn to be worried when she spots the key around Stacey's neck. Tamwar invites Nancy to stay with him for a while to escape the stress at the Vic, but Lee has an unexpectedly extreme reaction to the news, and Carol tries to help Max get his life back on track.(n)

programme.title: Ear to the Ground
programme.desc: Munster Family Farm of the Year winner Con Murphy talks about his struggles with depression. Plus, an interview with Barbara Fryday, one of Ireland's first female priests, and a report exploring how designating land as a protected area for hen harriers can render it almost worthless for farming. Presented by Darragh McCullough, Helen Carroll and Ella McSweeney.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The doting mother's hectic house becomes a little more noisy when she finds herself lumbered with a new guest - a homeless parrot. To add to her problems, she is on a desperate mission to make sure grandson Bono doesn't get sent to the infamous local primary school, against his parents' wishes. At least she has her New Year's Eve party to look forward to - which seems to be going well, until her guests start dropping like flies. Will she be left to sing Auld Lang Syne all alone? Festive episode of the hit sitcom, starring Brendan O'Carroll. First broadcast in 2013.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: The Lance Armstrong Story - Stop at Nothing: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary about the Lance Armstrong scandal, when the seven-time Tour de France winner was revealed to be one of the most notorious drug cheats in sporting history. Featuring contributions from some of the cyclist's former friends and team members, the film reveals how Armstrong's cheating and bullying became more extreme until colleagues began to speak out against him.(n)

programme.title: Sarajevo, 1914: the Eve of the Great War
programme.desc: Premiere. Following the motorcade assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, magistrate Dr Leo Pfeffer is appointed by the Austro-Hungarian Empire to confirm what Vienna wants to hear - that the Serbian government was behind the attack. Pfeffer soon finds himself drawn ever deeper into the web of corruption until it becomes practically impossible for him to maintain his integrity. Florian Teichtmeister stars in this dramatisation of event set in the summer of 1914 in the lead-up to the outbreat of the First World War. In German.

Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo. Last in the series.(c)

Darragh Maloney presents, with analysis from Colm O'Rourke, Ger Loughnane and Tomás Mulchay.(c)

He discovers both have fallen into the hands of a mysterious criminal mastermind with a grudge against Britain and a connection with 007's past. Spy adventure, with Pierce Brosnan, Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco and Famke Janssen.(c)

programme.desc: Homer, the Reverend Lovejoy and Apu go on holiday with their children - but while they are away, Moe mischievously writes each of them a letter in which he threatens to run off with one of their wives. Unaware it is a hoax, the trio are left to think about tempestuous times in their relationships.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: John is shocked when Jett announces he is planning to join the army. Leah tells Zac and VJ about her health concerns, and Alf learns he may have post-traumatic stress disorder.(n)

programme.desc: Eliza accepts Henry's challenge to do something helpful over the weekend and reluctantly offers to babysit Charmonique's young son on a Saturday night..Comedy, starring Karen Gillan and John Cho.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A seemingly routine surveillance job takes a deadly turn for Catherine and her ex, Billy, leading the team to a hitman. McGarrett is desperate to find Doris, so he turns to retired Navy Seal Joe White for help in locating his elusive mother, while Adam considers giving himself up to the Yakuza to save Kono.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: The return of the drama about two Soviet spies living undercover in suburban Washington, DC, during the 1980. Tensions simmer between the Jenningses as they disagree over handling orders from the Centre and Philip enlists Annelise for a mission when Elizabeth loses key intelligence. Stan tries a new approach to mending his marriage with Sandra. Starring Matthew Rhys and Keri Russell.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley in the USA
programme.sub-title: Girls Behind Bars: Stacey Dooley in the USA
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley explores different aspects of American life, beginning by meeting girls who are preparing to face time in `Shock' - the country's only prison boot camp for women, and spends time in a medium-security jail to see what they will have to face if they don't succeed.(n)

programme.title: Soccer Republic
programme.desc: Peter Collins presents a look back at the Women's World Cup final and highlights of the latest Airtricity League Premier Division fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of a high-speed police interception unit in Essex. Officers chase a drug dealer on a motorway at night, a drink-driver endangers his life in a bid to avoid arrest and the team pursues one of the area's most wanted car thieves.

programme.title: Style Wars
programme.desc: Caprice judges the efforts of the remaining seven contestants as they design a feature page for a magazine inspired by a flavour of tea assigned to them. The layouts must impress consumers, the client and the panel, and each hopeful is given one day to prepare for a photoshoot.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show USA
programme.sub-title: Your Family Calls My Baby Ugly, but I'll Prove He's Yours
programme.desc: The host takes his successful talk show stateside, where he invites American guests to air their differences, and dispenses his own judgment on the situation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Xposé
programme.desc: Karen Koster, Aisling O'Loughlin, Glenda Gilson, Lisa Cannon and Peter O'Riordan present a round-up of stories from the world of showbusiness, covering everything from film premieres and awards ceremonies to concerts and fashion shows.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Harriet Walter (Law & Order: UK) joins the cast as the costume drama returns. Following Matthew's shocking death, new mother Mary is struggling to come to terms with her loss, and Robert and Violet disagree over how to handle the situation. Downstairs, Jimmy finally takes an interest in Ivy, while Carson receives an unwelcome reminder of his past. Mrs Hughes sees a chance to help grief-stricken Isobel, and Thomas has the children's nanny in his sights. Michelle Dockery, Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Ed Speleers and Phyllis Logan also star.(c)

programme.title: Ireland's Midwives
programme.desc: Polish-born Agneiska Zaman excitedly awaits the birth of her first baby, unsure of what motherhood will bring, while Bernice Kennedy from Dublin feels nervous about the impending birth of her twin boys. The staff also turn their attention to a patient attending the diabetes clinic of the hospital.(c)

programme.title: The Best of Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine featuring a weekly round-up of health issues, entertainment news and personalities making the headlines.(c)

programme.title: The Great Irish Bake Off
programme.desc: The culinary contest returns to test the skills of 12 passionate home bakers as they battle it out to be crowned Best Amateur Baker by judges Paul Kelly and Biddy White Lennon. In the first edition, the hopefuls must make a cake that displays their personality to the judges, before they face a dreaded technical challenge. Presented by Anna Nolan.(c)

programme.title: Adoption Stories
programme.desc: Cliona was adopted into a loving family where she wanted for nothing. Sadly, her partner and father died within days of each other, so in her grief, she decided to go in search of her birth mother. Meanwhile, Terri, whose baby was taken from her by nuns in a mother-and-baby home, decided that once her son turned 18, she would attempt to make contact with him. But it was not quite so straightforward.(c)

programme.title: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: The deadline of St Patrick's Day is looming and, while Jack and Stephen Teeling's distillery is finally starting to take shape, delays and snag are playing an all-too important role in the development of the project. Can the brothers open on time or will they be forced to let down their customers and tour groups? Last in the series.(c)

programme.title: Dublin Airport: Life Stories
programme.desc: The site's fire officers are trained to tackle an aircraft blaze, and charity representative Sean Farrell from Longford prepares to return to Uganda after visiting Ireland with his wife and baby daughter. Elsewhere, a man waits for his sister to arrive, and a woman says goodbye to her father.(c)

programme.title: Sitting on a Fortune
programme.sub-title: Wayne and Brendan, Jonathan and Niall, Plus Jake and Alessia
programme.desc: Brian Dowling presents another edition of the fast-paced game-show, challenging Limerick duo Wayne and Brendan to spend as much time as possible sitting idle in studio chairs while facing off against fellow Shannonsiders Jonathan and Niall, and Dublin pair Alessia and her best friend Jake.(c)

programme.title: Glee
programme.desc: New series. As the New Directions come together again, Mr Schue gives them something to shout about - a chance to tackle the music of the Beatles. Will they be able to carry that weight or will they be crying out for help? Sue Sylvester is back - and as if that weren't bad enough, she's now been made headmistress - while over in New York, Rachel's ambitions take an unexpected turn.(c)

programme.title: The Cube
programme.desc: Gym instructor Chris thinks he can use his fitness skills to win big, while student Sophie hopes she can outsmart The Cube. Both contestants try to complete a series of increasingly difficult challenges, ranging from agility tests to skill trials, under pressure to hold their nerve as friends, family and the studio audience watch their every move. The further they go in the competition, the more money they win, up to a jackpot of £250,000. Phillip Schofield hosts.(c)

programme.title: The Park
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into the scenery, plants and wildlife of Killarney National Park, Co Kerry. Featuring rare footage of wildlife on land, in the air and under water, and focusing on endangered species that have found a haven within Ireland's oldest National Park. The first programme looks at the beauty of summer, the busiest time of the year for the park's wildlife, and introduces the first white-tailed eagle to be born in Ireland for more than a century.(c)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Former Dancing on Ice judge Karen Barber, TV presenter Dick Strawbridge, Coronation Street's Catherine Tyldesley (Eva Price) and comedian Russell Kane compete to win thousands of pounds for charity by pitting their general knowledge against one of the show's resident trivia experts. However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh hosts.(c)

programme.title: Celebrity Squares
programme.desc: Through the Keyhole's Keith Lemon, cricketing hero Andrew Flintoff, Olympic gold medallist Denise Lewis, actor Antony Cotton (Corrie's Sean Tully), Loose Women's Andrea McLean, Kaye Adams and Nadia Sawalha and comedians Rob Beckett and Hal Cruttenden join regulars Tim Vine and Joe Wilkinson in the grid, helping contestants win cash prizes. Warwick Davis hosts the revived Noughts and Crosses-based game show.(c)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.(c)

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: TV presenter Julia Bradbury (Countryfile) and darts champion Phil `The Power' Taylor are joined by their families to answer a series of seemingly simple questions based on a survey of 100 members of the public. The winning team then goes on to the Big Money round, where a jackpot of £30,000 can be won for charity. Vernon Kay hosts the long-running game show.(c)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary-room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(c)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: A single mother desperate for work pleads her way into a routine administrative job at a law firm. It is not long before she stumbles across mislaid documents about a case brought against a corporation for poisoning the residents of a small town by contaminating their water supply. Realising something is amiss, she begins her own investigation. Fact-based drama, with Julia Roberts in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Albert Finney and Aaron Eckhart.(c)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The Essex-based high-speed police interception unit pursues a gang of would-be jewellery thieves, while a burglar leads the team on a car chase.(c)

programme.title: The Best of Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine featuring a weekly round-up of health issues, entertainment news and personalities making the headlines.(n)

programme.desc: Karen Koster, Aisling O'Loughlin, Glenda Gilson, Lisa Cannon and Peter O'Riordan present a round-up of stories from the world of showbusiness, covering everything from film premieres and awards ceremonies to concerts and fashion shows.(n)

programme.title: Ireland AM
programme.desc: Magazine programme featuring health, politics and education reports, entertainment news and interviews with personalities making the headlines. With hosts Mark Cagney, Sinead Desmond, Alan Hughes, Aidan Cooney and Anna Daly.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Midday
programme.desc: Elaine Crowley and panellists chat about the issues that matter to women from all walks of life - from major news stories of the day, to their health and everyday problems, with live feedback from viewers.(n)

programme.title: News at 12:30

programme.title: Wimbledon 2015
programme.desc: Coverage of day seven at the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' fourth-round matches are scheduled to begin in the third Grand slam tournament of the year. The corresponding day of last year's tournament saw 2013 champion Andy Murray record a straight-sets victory over Kevin Anderson on the Centre Court, and immediately after that Novak Djokovic followed suit by beating Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in three sets. Despite inclement weather impeding the action once again, there was time for Sabine Lisicki to defeat Ana Ivaonovic 6-4, 3-6, 6-1 on the No.1 Court, but the contest between Angelique Kerber and Maria Sharapova had to be held over until the following day.(n)
